discussion.content: I think B is much better. Even though the virus morphs or behaves differently, the binary file should still contain the same hash.

comments.content: No this is definitely D. This is clearly a reference to Behavior Analysis for Heuristic detection.

questions.question_text: A security analyst receives a mobile device with symptoms of a virus infection. The virus is morphing whenever it is from sandbox to sandbox to analyze. Which of the following will help to identify the number of variations through the analysis life cycle?

discussion.content:
The more I'm reading the comments on some of these questions, the more convinced I am that there are trolls on this board. The correct - albeit vague - answer is B:
A. Yes, they are. Here's a couple: CVE-2015-0987, CVE-2015-1015, CVE-2017-2680, CVE-2017-12741, CVE-2015-2177, CVE-2016-9158, CVE-2016-9159, CVE-2017-14464, CVE-2017-14473, CVE-2017-14472, CVE-2017-14471, CVE-2017-14470, CVE-2017-14469, CVE-2017-14468, CVE-2017-14467, CVE-2017-14466, CVE-2017-14465, CVE-2017-14463, CVE-2017-14462, CVE-2017-12090, CVE-2017-12089, CVE-2017-12088, CVE-2017-16740, CVE-2017-2681, CVE-2017-6030, CVE-2018-7789, CVE-2018-7790, CVE-2018-7791, CVE-2018-7792, CVE-2017-16744, CVE-2012-4701, CVE-2012-4028, CVE-2012-4027, CVE-2012-3025, CVE-2015-7937, CVE-2016-7090 & CVE-2012-3024
B. This is the only applicable answer.
C. That's just not true.
D. Quite the opposite is true, but even if it was, I don't see how it could affect remediation.

I say B

https://electricenergyonline.com/energy/magazine/181/article/SCADA-System-Vulnerabilities-to-Cyber-Attack.htm

Summary:
SCADA system vendors, like most of us, never thought that 9/11 and Oklahoma City could happen. Therefore no one designed SCADA systems with integral protections against a cyber attack. They were designed to be tolerant of minor human error and to keep out the honest.................
Has to be B here. Question asks why they may be difficult to remediate. Feel like lack of security functionality would be the best answer here....

comments.content: do you have any reference for that mate?
That may be an issuing for identifying the issue. This is asking for the issue w/ remediation.

discussion.content: It is A, as ICS don't use the CVSS/CVE system for known vulnerabilities

comments.content: I think B is a good choice. ICS/SCADA systems have been developed more than a decade ago or a few years back when security is not a top concern.

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST describes why vulnerabilities found in ICS and SCADA can be difficult to remediate?

choices.D: ICS/SCADA systems use encrypted traffic to communicate between devices.
choices.C: ICS/SCADA systems do not allow remote connections.
choices.A: ICS/SCADA systems are not supported by the CVE publications.
choices.B: ICS/SCADA systems rarely have full security functionality.

discussion.content: This question was in the exam :)

questions.question_text: An administrator has been investigating the way in which an actor had been exfiltrating confidential data from a web server to a foreign host. After a thorough forensic review, the administrator determined the server's BIOS had been modified by rootkit installation. After removing the rootkit and flashing the BIOS to a known good state, which of the following would BEST protect against future adversary access to the BIOS, in case another rootkit is installed?

comments.content: You are 100% correct. The answer should be B.

discussion.content: It is normal for remediating/patching vulnerabilities to cause downtime/service interruptions. That's why a change control process should be in place to minimize the downtime, and ensure that the downtime is scheduled on out of business hours. Security regression testing won't prevent/affect the downtime as vulnerabilities they are remediated.

C makes more sense... Before deploying any remediation activity, test the planned fixes in a sandbox environment. This ensures no unforeseen side effects are missed and mitigates the likely hood that remediation activities will disrupt business operations... Then one submits a change control process when time to implement the fixes.. I wonder about some people response here...

comments.content: regression testing is done on an already existing application that has been updated, not on a new application

discussion.content: B - Change control process is the right answer. We do this all the time in my organisation to prevent downtime and service failure.

questions.question_text:
The security team for a large, international organization is developing a vulnerability management program. The development staff has expressed concern that the new program will cause service interruptions and downtime as vulnerabilities are remedied.
Which of the following should the security team implement FIRST as a core component of the remediation process to address this concern?

discussion.content: This question was on the exam (october-2020)

“Every application that is run on the Android platform must be signed by the developer”
“Android provides code signing using self-signed certificates that developers can generate without external assistance or permission.”
source: https://source.android.com/security/apksigning
the correct answer is B

I initially went with C. However, this question could be worded a little better as we don't know how the developer is signing their code. After looking into this, Google will allow you to self sign your certificate without the need of purchasing a code signing certificate. So, I can see where B may be the answer.

I'd go with C, I don't see how they got B as an answer, the application is specifically for "mobile". If it was a computer application I could see machine/computer certs being issued/signed to provide authenticity, but since this is mobile either Apple or Google (two major) would sign the code.

questions.question_text:
A company is developing its first mobile application, which will be distributed via the official application stores of the two major mobile platforms.
Which of the following is a prerequisite to making the applications available in the application stores?
